issue.title: Refactor Joint into multivariate Delta and Contraction
issue.body:
This PR removes `Joint` in favor of a normalized multivariate `Delta` which is closed under addition and `Contraction` from #156 and internally represents all log-densities with a single tensor.  It also deletes lots of duplicate test code made redundant by the removal of `Joint`, while preserving behavior in all existing tests that exercised `Joint`.

This is quite a large PR with lots of changes since `Joint` was used throughout the codebase.  I'll add a review/merge plan for this series of PRs to the master issue #156.

It's almost complete, except for these remaining todos:
- [x] Add default pattern to `moment_matching` so that tests pass
- [x] Add a couple of remaining missing patterns for reduction and integration with `MultiDelta`
- [x] Fix minor type/shape bug in lazy advanced indexing
- [x] Add pattern for `Independent` for `MultiDelta`, `Contraction`

issue.title: Support Gaussian funsors in sequential_sum_product

milestone.title: Initial release
milestone.description: Working implementations of the examples in the design doc as well as any necessary infrastructure

issue.body:
Addresses #177 

This adds `Gaussian` support to `sequential_sum_product()`. This required:
- supporting `Gaussian` and `Joint` in our ad-hoc `Cat` funsor
- adding a `Joint.align()` method
- fixing typos in `sequential_sum_product()` (as @eb8680 and I noticed offline)

Note this means we can now implement asymptotically fast Kalman filter learning with funsor. (Provisos include: (1) only for full-rank observation distributions, (2) fast asymptotically, but with a big constant factor due to our broadcast-multiply-reduce implementation of gaussian_gemm).

## Tested
- added a grid of normal and multivariate normal tests to test_sum_product.py

issue.title: Project: Implement time series models usable in Pyro

milestone.title: Initial release
milestone.description: Working implementations of the examples in the design doc as well as any necessary infrastructure

issue.body:
This issue plans PRs required to implement Bayesian filtering models in funsor that can then be used within Pyro models. We'd like to include a number of these in the initial release.

## Low level algorithms and math
- [x] #161  Implement `sequential_sum_product()` for discrete HMMs
- [x] #176 Implement `sequential_sum_product()` for Gaussian HMMs
- [x] #183 Support multiple variables in `sequential_sum_product()`
- [x] #173 Support multivariate linear pattern matching for linear-Gaussian filtering
- [x] #178 Implement partial substitution of Gaussian funsors 
- [x] #186 #184 Support rank-deficient operands in Gaussians ops
- ~~Implement a "Gaussian GEMM" that avoids the broadcast-multiply-reduce pattern (see `pyro.ops.gaussian.gaussian_tensordot()` https://github.com/pyro-ppl/pyro/pull/1980)~~ moved to https://github.com/pyro-ppl/funsor/issues/238
- ~~#167 Implement a `markov_sum_product()` for structured HMMs with arbitrary time window~~

## High level components
- [x] #170 Implement a `FunsorDistribution` wrapper to embed funsor distributions in Pyro
- [x] #174 #175 Implement funsor-pyro conversion functions
- [x] #205 Promote `funsor.sum_product.Slice` from an ad-hoc function to a `Funsor`
- [x] #206 Implement `eager_cat` for `Tensor`, `Gaussian`, `Joint` (cross listed in #162)
- ~~#70 Add a `Markov` or `Convolve` funsor~~

## Models as distributions
- [x] #171 Implement `DiscreteHMM` as a `FunsorDistribution`
- [x] #179 Implement a `GaussianMRF`
- [x] #185 Implement a `GaussianHMM`
- ~~#182 Implement a `GaussianDiscreteMRF`~~
- ~~#180 Implement a switching linear dynamical system MRF~~
- [x]  #187 Implement a switching linear dynamical system HMM
- ~~Implement a Tensor Monte Carlo smoothing `FunsorDistribution`~~

issue.title: Promote Slice to a funsor
issue.body:
Addresses #162, #177 

This adds a `Slice` funsor for use in `sequential_sum_product()`. Before this PR, `Slice` was simulated as `arange` and thus triggered a tensor copy. After this PR slicing is zero-copy.

## Tested
- unit tests
- refactoring is covered by `sequential_sum_product()` tests

issue.title: Implement Cat funsor
issue.body:
Addresses #162, #177 

This promotes `Cat` to a funsor, implemented using variadic pattern matching following #157 so that homogeneous Stack/Tensor/Gaussian/Joint funsors can be concatenated eagerly.

This also reorders `Stack(components,name)` -> `Stack(name,parts)` to agree with `Cat` and make it a little cleaner for both funsors to use variadic pattern matching.

This does not implement every possible `Cat` pattern; rather this PR aims to implement only what is needed for `sequential_sum_product()`.

## Tested
- unit tests for `Cat` and eager Tensor fusion
- refactoring is exercised by `sequential_sum_product()` tests

issue.title: Fix dependent type inference in funsor.torch.arange

milestone.title: Initial release
milestone.description: Working implementations of the examples in the design doc as well as any necessary infrastructure

issue.body:
Addresses #162 

This PR ports the bound inference from `SliceMeta` and #161 to `funsor.torch.arange`.

Tested:
- Copied tests for `Slice` of `Tensor` in `test_torch.py`
